intro: Tilia frivaldszkyanorum, commonly known as the Frivaldszky lime, is a rare and endangered species of flowering tree native to the Carpathian Basin. It belongs to the Tiliaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant is adapted to specific soil conditions and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
